full_text:
Policy Changes and Preemption

Lesson
objectives

Perform a policy change

Change the effective date of a policy change
Interpret policy transaction graphs

Describe preemption behavior

Handle preemptions

Dahlia
Underwriter

How do ! change a policy using the application?
Also, what does the application do if | make
multiple changes to a policy?

| Policy Change i

« Achange transaction, or
policy change, changes a
policy term prior to its
expiration date

eoe

* Changes might mean:

* Coverables are added to or
removed from the policy

* Coverages are added to or
removed from coverables

* Coverage terms are modified

| Demonstration G

Policy change

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

| Edit the effective date of an unbound policy change [5

¢ An effective date can be edited after a
policy change has started, before it is
issued

Coton. 2 (Draft) > Personal Auto

Account File S

r
Policy File -

¢ After the policy change is issued, Create r =
another policy change transaction is
required if the effective date of the
policy data needs to be changed

again.

New Note
New Document >

New Activity >

Edit
Copy Data
Archiving

Enable/Disable

| The effective date is edited on the policy change fa

Editing this policy transaction will invalidate the current quote and may

require re-approval by underwriting. Are you sure you want to continue?

May require UW approval ka Cancel

‘

Policy Change Summary

Effective Date *] 11/01/2018

Description Car purchase delayed by month

The effective date of a policy change transaction must be within the boundaries of
the same policy term.

Darren
Insurance
Product Manager

| need to make sure our full team knows how
preemptions work. Can you show an example?

| Simple scenarios Gi

Policy comes Policy renewed
into effect or expires

Bound: 1/20
Eff: 1/20

Bound: 3/07
Eff: 4/01

Bound: 5/18
Eff: 5/10

Bound: 7/01 _—
Ef 7/20 Ca

Scenarios remain simple when:
* Transactions are executed in sequence (B starts only after A finishes)

* Transactions become effective in sequence (B becomes effective after A)

| Base periods i

Policy comes Policy renewed
into effect or expires
Submission Base for change 1
Change 1 L
Submission
Change 1 base for change 2
Change 2 L

Most policy transactions modify a copy of an existing PolicyPeriod

* This period is known as the "base period" for that transaction

| What may lead to Preemptions? fa

Policy comes Policy renewed
into effect or expires
Submission | [PTs Ai
Change
Change

Preemption is a phenomenon which occurs when two transactions have been
initiated from the same base period

* This occurs when a new transaction is started while another transaction is still in progress

| Preempting job fa

Policy comes Policy renewed
into effect or expires

Submission
Change

Preempted ie >|
change

When two or more jobs are started from same base period, the first job to be bound
preempts (wins out over) all other jobs

* Losing jobs must be modified to handle preemption

| Demonstration G

Preemption

original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

| Preemption warning: Policy change fa

n
change

Offerings

Handling preemptions G

You can either apply all
changes or withdraw the
change transaction

Transaction

Offerings

Your Policy Change was preempted by Policy Change 0001606720. You will need to
handle these preemptions before continuing.

Handle Preemptions

‘Change was preempted by the transactions below. Please view these changes and decide
continue your Policy Change with these changes applied or to withdraw your Policy Change.

Policy Change 0001606720

Comparing Existing Policy and Policy Change: 0001606720

Item Existing Policy Policy Change: 0001606720

= Vehicles

= 2001 Acura RSXin California

Color Red Yellow

| Applying all changes from preempting job fa

Policy comes Policy renewed
into effect or expires

Submission | [C71
Change | EET ETTC
Change ENN HTUCKEEEAR

py -by-

If all changes from preempting job are applied, then the period created from the
preempting (winning) transaction becomes the base period for the preempted
(losing) transaction

Question G

_ _ For each of the following, identify whether the statement applies to
,’ submission jobs, change jobs, or both.

y A)
B)
C)
D)
E)
F)

SoS oD DD DDS De Say

It can be started manually.

It can only be executed from an existing policy.
It requires you to identify the producer of record.
It can be withdrawn.

It can be declined.

It requires a new quote to be generated.

Answer

Gi

_ _ For each of the following, identify whether the statement applies to
,’ submission jobs, change jobs, or both.

D. Both E. Both F. Both

I B) Itcan only be executed from an existing policy.
